properties.headline: SPECIAL EVENT - SYDNEY CBD AND PYRMONT Various Roads

arrangementAttachments.linkName: Road closures and special event clearways

properties.publicTransport:
Line one about buses
Line two more about buses
Something in bold
properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures will be in place between 4am and 11am in the Sydney CBD, The Rocks and Pyrmont on Sunday 19 May for the Half Marathon. Special event clearways in place from 3am.

Major road closures include:
CAHILL EXPRESSWAY: between the Sydney Harbour Bridge and Macquarie St.
WESTERN DISTRIBUTOR: between Harbour St and Druitt St, including some on-ramps and off-ramps.
SYDNEY CBD: Sussex St, Phillip St, Alfred St, Loftus St and Macquarie St.
THE ROCKS: George St, Hickson Rd and Kent St.
PYRMONT: Pyrmont St, Pirrama Rd, Jones Bay Rd and Darling Drive.

Special event clearways will be in place throughout the Sydney CBD, Pyrmont and Ultimo. Check signs before parking as vehicles left in special event clearways will be towed and a towing fee applies.

If you are travelling to the SMH Half Marathon, consider the public transport options. Go to 131500.com.au to plan your trip.

arrangementElements.html:
Roads will be progressively re-opened by RMS and Police after cleaning.

Sydney, Pyrmont, Ultimo

Between 4am to 10am

  • Allen St between Harris St and Pyrmont St
  • Pyrmont St between Pyrmont Bridge Rd and Quarry St
  • Quarry St between Harris St and Pyrmont St

Notes:

A) Local access to Pyrmont St south of Quarry St will be via traffic control at Harris St and Quarry St.

Access is for vehicles southbound on Harris St making a left turn into Quarry St only.

B) Local access to Gipps St, Experiment St, the Harris St car park and the Pyrmont St resident underground car parks will be via traffic control on Harris St at Allen St. Access is for vehicles southbound on Harris St making a left hand turn into Allen St only.

Sydney Harbour Bridge

Between 4am to 10am

  • Cahill Expressway between Sydney Harbour Bridge and Macquarie St
  • Kent St on ramp between Kent St and Sydney Harbour Bridge

Western Distributor

Between 4am to 10am

  • Western Distributor between Harbour St and Druitt St (southbound)
  • Western Distributor Fig St on ramp (eastbound)
  • Western Distributor Harris St off ramp (westbound)
  • Western Distributor King St off ramp (northbound)
  • Western Distributor Pyrmont St on ramp (southbound)
  • Western Distributor Market St on ramp (westbound)

Traffic on the Western Distributor wanting to access the Sydney Harbour Bridge will be diverted via the Bathurst St exit and can turn left into Harbour St.

The Western Distributor westbound is only accessible from Druitt St or the Cross City Tunnel. Traffic leaving the Harbour Bridge southbound on the Western Distributor will be diverted onto Harbour St.

What are special event clearways?

You must not stop or park on a length of road where a Special Event Clearway sign applies: no exceptions.

Holders of residential parking permits are not exempt.

The drivers of public buses, taxis and hire cars are permitted to stop when dropping off or picking up passengers only.

If your vehicle is left on a Special Event Clearway it will be towed away, usually to a nearby street, and fines will apply. Check for signage when parking.

properties.headline: SPECIAL EVENT - MOORE PARK Various roads
properties.otherAdvice:
Special event clearways will be in place between 3pm and 11pm in Moore Park and surrounding areas on Saturday 25 May for the NRL Sydney Roosters v Melbourne Storm match at Allianz Stadium kicking off at 7.30pm.

Check signs before parking as vehicles left in special event clearways will be towed and a towing fee applies.

For the safety of pedestrians, parts of Driver Avenue may be closed to traffic prior to, during and after the game. It will reopen to traffic once crowds have left the area.

If you are planning to attend the NRL game, consider the public transport options.

Plan your trip at www.131500.com.au or call 131 500.

arrangementElements.html:

  • Lang Road between Cook Road and Anzac Parade (both sides)
  • Moore Park Road between Flinders Street and Driver Avenue (northern side)
  • Moore Park Road between Poate Road and Anzac Parade (southern side)

properties.otherAdvice:
Special event clearways will be in place between 3pm and 11pm in Moore Park and surrounding areas on Saturday 18 May for the AFL Sydney Swans v Fremantle Dockers match at the Sydney Cricket Ground starting at 7.40pm.

Check signs before parking as vehicles left in special event clearways will be towed and a towing fee applies.

For the safety of pedestrians, parts of Driver Avenue may be closed to traffic prior to, during and after the game. It will reopen to traffic once crowds have left the area.

If you are planning to attend the AFL game, consider the public transport options.

Plan your trip at www.131500.com.au or call 131 500.

properties.headline: SPECIAL EVENT - BERRY Princes Hwy between Edward St and Woodhill Mountain Rd
properties.otherAdvice: The Princes Highway will be closed for one hour from 9am to 10am on Saturday 25th May between Edward Street and Woodhill Mountain Road.
properties.diversions:
A detour will be in place for motorists via Albert and Edward streets.
B Double and larger heavy vehicles will not be able to use the detour and will be parked while the highway is closed.

properties.headline: SPECIAL EVENT - SYDNEY CBD Various Roads

arrangementAttachments.linkName: Road closures and special event clearways

properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures will be in place in the Sydney CBD on Sunday 2 June for the Procession of the Blessed Sacrament.

Roads will begin closing between midday and 2pm, and will progressively reopen by 5pm.

The road closures in the Sydney CBD include Grosvenor, Bridge, Castlereagh, College, Elizabeth, King, George and Pitt streets.

Due to these road closures, motorists should take an alternative route, allow additional travel time and expect delays in the city.

Hospital Road is accessible at all times via St Mary's Road.

Special event clearways will be in place between 11am and 5pm throughout the Sydney CBD. Check signs before parking as vehicles left in special event clearways will be towed and a towing fee applies.

Bus services that normally travel along the Procession route will be diverted until the roads reopen.

If you are travelling to the Sydney CBD, consider the public transport options.

To plan your trip at 131500.com.au or phone 131500.

properties.headline: SPECIAL EVENT - SYDNEY OLYMPIC PARK Various Roads
properties.otherAdvice:
Heavy traffic is expected along the M4, Homebush Bay Drive and Silverwater Road for the Super Rugby match between the Waratahs v Brumbies at ANZ Stadium on Saturday 18 May - kick off is at 7.40pm.

There will be Limited parking. Public transport is the best option with all tickets to the game including travel on CityRail services, Sydney Olympic Park Major Event Buses and regular Sydney Buses services, Liverpool to Parramatta T-way buses and Sydney Ferries services.
